trans-unit.source: Are you interested in working for the association? We are looking forward to you!
trans-unit.target: Are you interested in working for the association? We are looking forward to you!

trans-unit.source: You do not have to be a member of the association to participate. But as a full member you have your own voting rights in the corresponding boards of the association. All legal documents of the association are linked at the bottom of this page.
trans-unit.target: Become a part of DD-IX! You as a natural person can actively participate and have a say in the daily life of IX as a regular member. Companies and legal entities can become supporting members, support our mission on a monthly basis, can present themselves at events and receive regular updates. Sponsors, such as an organisation, company or individual, can support us with one-time donations and receive visibility on our website in the sponsors tab. Join now and support our mission!

trans-unit.source: The association is made up of committed members who work voluntarily for the achievement of the goals. Even though the association seems to be technical through IXP operations we are also involved in non-technical areas.
trans-unit.target: The association is made up of committed members who work voluntarily for the achievement of the association's goals. Even though the association seems to be technical through IXP operations, we are also involved in non-technical areas.

trans-unit.source: The aim of peering is to route traffic between the participating networks more efficiently and to avoid bottlenecks. Through peering connections provided by DD-IX, we enable all participants to route network packets among each other shorter and faster.
trans-unit.target: The goal of peering is to distribute Internet traffic between the participating networks as directly as possible. Direct routing is cheaper, reduces latency, and improves robustness. The DD-IX peering infrastructure is the base to enable this.

trans-unit.source: The work in the association is organized in different boards and working groups:
trans-unit.target: The work in the association is organized in different boards and working groups:

trans-unit.source: We want to promote Saxony as an attractive IT location with a focus on Dresden. Our main focus is the further expansion of the internet communication network. We committ as non-profit organisation for:
trans-unit.target: We want to further promote the region of Saxony, with a focus on Dresden, as an attractive IT location. Our main focus is on the further expansion of the Internet. To achieve this goal, we focus on:

trans-unit.source: In addition to supporting the community, we run the internet exchange DD-IX at locations in Dresden. DD-IX sees itself as an open, non-profit platform for all internet participants with a AS in the region of Saxony.
trans-unit.target: In addition to supporting the community, we run the Dresden Internet Exchange. The DD-IX sees itself as an open, non-profit platform for all Internet participants with their own AS in the Saxony region.

trans-unit.source: Besides the peering LAN and our route servers for the core operation of the IXP, we run most of the systems of the association ourselves.
trans-unit.target: Besides the peering LAN and our route servers for the core operation of the IXP, we run most of the systems of the association ourselves.

trans-unit.source: Always stay updated by subscribing to our news mailing-list.
trans-unit.target: Always stay updated by subscribing to our news mailing-list.

trans-unit.source: How about jumping back to the home page?
trans-unit.target: How about jumping back to the home page?

trans-unit.source: Peering is a term from network technology. It enables ISPs (Internet Service Providers) or network operators to easily exchange data with each other. This data transfer between peering partners is free of charge and offers numerous advantages.
trans-unit.target: Peering is a term from network technology. It enables large and small network operators to easily exchange data with each other. This type of data transfer offers numerous advantages.

trans-unit.source: Optimal network packet forwarding is an important aspect of building a robust and efficient Internet. Peering with an IXP allows access to content and services provided by other network operators or ISPs without the need to establish many direct peerings among each other.
trans-unit.target: Fast packet delivery is key for almost all Internet services and applications. Peering at an IXP reduces detours between those who consume content and services and those who offer them.

trans-unit.source: An IXP also enables better resilience, as traffic can be transmitted even if a link to a particular network fails, as long as there are routes through alternative peering partners.
trans-unit.target: An Internet Exchange Point enables better resilience since it increases the level of Internet connectivity. IXPs are a platform to meet other networks and directly connect to them. Internet Exchange Points are particularly interesting for Content Delivery Networks (CDN) and Internet Service Providers (ISP).

trans-unit.source: Peering through an IXP like the DD-IX reduces the need for expensive Internet transit services. Because only the connection are paid for and not the data volume used.
trans-unit.target: Peering through an IXP like the DD-IX reduces the need for expensive Internet transit services. Only the connections are paid and not the data volume used. Using a central peering point also helps to reduce maintaining peering sessions. Instead of running multiple BGP sessions, a single session is needed to reach networks on site.

trans-unit.source: We are a reliable point of contact for organizations, science, business, and the public on issues relating to the internet. In addition to the exchange of experiences within the association and with external third parties, we conduct information and training events. Furthermore, we participate in community events.
trans-unit.target: We are a reliable point of contact for organizations, science, business, and the public on issues relating to the internet. In addition to the exchange of experiences within the association and with external third parties, we conduct information and training events. Furthermore, we participate in community events.

trans-unit.source: The DD-IX is an Internet exchange for Dresden and whole Saxony. As a non-commercial platform, we are open to all Internet stakeholders that are interested in multilateral exchange of Internet traffic. Only 20 km from the geographic center of Saxony, the DD-IX locations in Dresden offer the perfect fundament to peer with participants in the Saxony region over short distances.
trans-unit.target: The DD-IX is an Internet exchange for Dresden. As a non-commercial platform, we are open to all Internet stakeholders that are interested in multilateral exchange of Internet traffic. Only 20 km from the geographic center of Saxony, the DD-IX location in Dresden offer the perfect fundament to peer with participants in the Saxony region over short distances.

trans-unit.source: Join us for an exciting journey. As peer, sponsor, or member of the association you will be part of the development of the DD-IX - the catalyst for the digital future in Saxony!
trans-unit.target: As peer, sponsor, or member of the association you will be part of the development of the DD-IX - the catalyst for the digital future in Saxony!

trans-unit.source: The DD-IX is operated by committed people of the DD-IX Dresden Internet Exchange e.V. The DD-IX Dresden Internet Exchange e.V. is a registered association under German law. Our mission is the economical, ecological, and robust exchange of data over the Internet. To enable direct data delivery between source and destination, we leverage the unique advantages of an Internet Exchage Point (IXP).
trans-unit.target: The DD-IX is operated by committed people of the DD-IX Dresden Internet Exchange e.V. Our mission is the economical, ecological, and robust exchange of data over the Internet. To enable direct data delivery between source and destination, we leverage the unique advantages of an Internet Exchage Point (IXP).
